SENT.plain: We evaluated the usefulness of PGE2 on chemotherapy-associated oral mucosal lesions of the patients with hematological malignancies and compared the efficacy of the troche with that of the tablet
One hundred and fifty three patients were given 0.5 mg of these PGE2 topically three times daily
One hundred and fourty five cases were evaluable (Tablet; 85, Troche; 60)
1) Symptoms and signs were improved in 102/144 (70.8%) and 102/145 (70.3%), respectively
2) The improvement rates were 77.5% (55/71), 85.7% (6/7) and 62.7% (32/51) in leukocyte count-increased, -unchanged and -decreased patients, respectively
3) No background factor of the patients except performance status affected the improvement rate
4) Higher improvement rate was noted in the PGE2 early starting group (within 5 days after the appearance of oral lesions) than the late group (6 days and thereafter) (76.5% v.s
55.8%: U-test p less than 0.1, chi2-test p less than 0.05)
5) There was no difference in the efficacy rate between the tablet and the troche
6) Mild side effects were seen in 10 cases
These results suggest that topical administration of PGE2 is safe and useful for improving chemotherapy-associated oral mucosal lesions of patients with hematological malignancies
